page.title: 16HAZELBEACH REGATTA
page.content: The{Regatta}has a long history, but the tradition had lapsed until after the Queen's Silver Jubilee celebrations. Originally the events were for villagers only, but now many do not compete; they organise the{races,}set up and man the{stalls,}serve{teas, organise the{barbeque}and evening {Disco Dance. Most races take place in the bay so that spectators at Hazelbeach can see the events.{Competitors}include large yachts, power boats, small craft with outboard motors, rowing dinghies, home-built rafts and sail-boards. There are also swimming races and greasy pole competitions for children. {The President of the Day}is usually an important guest and duties include the presentation of trophies and cash prizes. by Mr. J. Garratt
